column4: hey, natulius isn't working for me, are there any other FTP clients for ubuntu?
try typing "ftp" into a Terminal :)
that doesn't help me :) i'm almost completely reliant on GUI to do anything
not that hard.  just type "ftp ftp.whatever.com" then you just "cd /whatever/directory/you/want" then "bin" then "get whatever"
thanks
what's the command to upload?
put whatever
if it's a text file/HTML file/something like that you want to put "a" then "put whatever"; if it's a binary you want "bin" then "put whatever"
a put filename.xml             ??  do i need to put /home/username/filename.xml?
i'm doing something wrong.  i get   local: put remote: [whatever i type in]   local: put: no such file or directory
ftp> put messages                   local: messages remote: messages           .....                   290894 bytes sent in 0.02 secs (13367.0 kB/s)
i'm sorry for being so worthless but i don't understand what you just said
that was my ftp output
just type "put filename"
nothing more
see if that works
200 PORT command successful
hmm
I get 200 PORT command successful. Consider using PASV.                                150 Ok to send data.                              226 File receive OK.
gftp does the same thing (stalls) got any suggestions on where to go?
Sounds like a server problem, not your problem
unless of course that's your server :)
have you tried Firefox?
yeah, i know it's something on my end, my laptop can connect and transfer fine
